sen.j: 1830年（天保元年）11月24日実伯父の乾正春が病気で無嗣子のため、正春の実弟で本山伊平の養子となっていた本山彦弥茂良（前名乾右馬之助茂良）の息子である本山楠弥太が、正春の養子となった。
sen.e: On November 24, 1830, because Masahiro's own uncle Masaharu INUI was sick and had no heir, Masaharu adopted Kusuyata MOTOYAMA (Masahiro's childhood name) who was a son of Hikoya Shigeyoshi MOTOYAMA (whose previous name was Umanosuke Shigeyoshi INUI) who was Masaharu's own younger brother and had been adopted into the Ihei MOTOYAMA's family.
sen.cmt: 文頭の年号が抜けていたので、Webに従って「1830年」を補いました。ちなみにWebには「1830年（天保元年）11月24日」と書かれているのですが、【換暦】で調べると「1830年11月24日」は「文政13年10月10日」、「天保元年」は「1831年1月23日」となり、日付がずれてしまいます。また、この文のように和暦の年号だけがカッコ内に記載されている場合、その後の日付は西暦の年号に続く新暦の日付であると解釈しました。
sen.e: On January 7, 1831, because Masahiro's own uncle Masaharu INUI was sick and had no heir, Masaharu adopted Kusuyata MOTOYAMA (Masahiro's childhood name), the son of Hikoya Shigeyoshi MOTOYAMA (whose previous name was Umanosuke Shigeyoshi INUI), who was the younger brother of Masaharu and had been adopted by Ihei MOTOYAMA.
sen.cmt: 「天保元年11月24日」を旧暦と解釈しました。1830年は1831年の間違いではないかと思います。
sen.e: On January 7, 1831, because Masahiro's own uncle Masaharu INUI was sick and had no heir, Masaharu adopted Kusuyata MOTOYAMA (Masahiro's childhood name), the son of Hikoya Shigeyoshi MOTOYAMA (whose previous name was Umanosuke Shigeyoshi INUI), who was the younger brother of Masaharu and had been adopted by Ihei MOTOYAMA.

sen.j: 1831年（天保2年）3月28日、養父正春の跡目五人扶持切府高十石之内の七石を下し置かれ、格式新御扈従を仰せ付けられた。
sen.e: On March 28, 1831, he was given seven koku of ten koku which was his adoptive father Masaharu's successive gonin fuchi (the equivalent of an annual five-man rice stipend) kippudaka (nominal amount), and he was appointed as a kyakushiki (social status) of shin-o-kosho (new attendant of a noble person).

On May 10, 1831, he was given seven koku of ten koku which was his adoptive father Masaharu's successive gonin fuchi (the equivalent of an annual five-man rice stipend) kippudaka (nominal amount), and he was appointed as a kyakushiki (social status) of shin-o-kosho (new attendant of a noble person).
sen.cmt: 「天保2年3月28日」を旧暦と解釈しました。

sen.j: 文久の政変の後、1864年（元治元年）5月13日京都で小目付役（小監察）御軍付御用仰せ付けられ、同時に尹宮様(朝彦親王)御用向御勤務を仰せ付けられ、白銀50枚を下された。
sen.e: After the Bunkyu Coup, on May 13, 1864, he was appointed as sho-metsuke-yaku (minor inspector of lower servants) to do official business belonging to the imperial army, and at the same time he was ordered to perform the services for Innomiya-sama (Imperial Prince Asahiko) with a fee of 50 silver coins.

After the Bunkyu Coup, on June 16, 1864, he was appointed as sho-metsuke-yaku (minor inspector of lower servants) to do official business belonging to the imperial army, and at the same time he was ordered to serve for Imperial Prince Asahiko with a fee of 50 silver coins.
sen.cmt: 「元治元年5月13日」を旧暦としました。
sen.e: After the Bunkyu Coup, on June 16, 1864, he was appointed as sho-metsuke-yaku (minor inspector of lower servants) to do official business belonging to the imperial army, and at the same time he was ordered to serve for Imperial Prince Asahiko with a fee of 50 silver coins.

sen.j: 同年7月17日長州兵の入京を阻止せんと欲し、薩摩藩士吉井幸輔、久留米藩士大塚敬介らと議して連署の意見書を朝廷に建白し、その決意を求めた(禁門の変)。
sen.e: On July 17 of the same year, wishing to prevent the Choshu soldiers from entering the capital Kyoto, he argued with a feudal retainer of the Satsuma domain Kosuke YOSHII, a feudal retainer of the Kurume domain Keisuke Otsuka, and so on, and petitioned Imperial Court with a written opinion which they signed jointly to require the determination (the Kinmon Incident).

On August 18 of the same year, wishing to prevent the Choshu soldiers from entering the capital Kyoto, he discussed with a feudal retainer of the Satsuma domain Kosuke YOSHII and a feudal retainer of the Kurume domain Keisuke Otsuka, and then they petitioned Imperial Court with a written opinion which they signed jointly to require the determination (the Kinmon Incident).
sen.cmt: 「元治元年7月17日」を旧暦としました。"argue"を"discuss"に変え、petitionedの前にtheyを補いました。
sen.e: On August 18 of the same year, wishing to prevent the Choshu soldiers from entering the capital Kyoto, he discussed with a feudal retainer of the Satsuma domain Kosuke YOSHII and a feudal retainer of the Kurume domain Keisuke Otsuka, and then they petitioned Imperial Court with a written opinion which they signed jointly to require the determination (the Kinmon Incident).

sen.j: 1866年（慶応2年）6月に長防探索用を命ぜられ探索方として活躍するが、その後消息不明（おそらく死亡）となり、無嗣子ゆえ止むを得ず板垣退助の次男乾正士を後嗣として家を継がしめた。
sen.e: In June, 1866, he was ordered to inspect Choshu (Nagato Province) and Boshu (Suo Province) and did a very good job as an inspector, but after a while he lost contact and became missing (probably he was killed), and because he had no heir, people selected the second son of Taisuke ITAGAKI Masashi INUI as an inheritor to make him succeed to the family.

In July 1866, he was ordered to inspect Choshu (Nagato Province) and Boshu (Suo Province) and did a very good job as an inspector, but after a while he lost contact and became missing (probably he was killed), and Masashi INUI, the second son of Taisuke ITAGAKI, was selected as the inheritor of succeeding to the INUI family because he had no heir.
sen.cmt: 「慶応2年6月」を旧暦としました。後半、受身の形に書き換えました。
